sentences.sContent: The experiment produced some unexpected results.
sentences.sCn: 这次试验产生了一些意想不到的结果。

sentences.sContent: Hague’s announcement was not entirely unexpected.
sentences.sCn: 黑格的声明并非完全出乎意料。

sentences.sContent: ...and disrupting the traditional routes could have unexpected side effects...
...having a plan B can help reduce the risks of unexpected and unaffordable results especially when it comes to important events...
...but it could take longer if something unexpected happened...
...Yet we know that difficulty can pay unexpected dividends...
...Professor Filreis says that he is "a little shocked" at how intensely his Wharton students respond to this unexpected deviation from the businesslike...

phrases.pCn: 意外的消息；出乎意料的新闻

trans.tranOther: used to describe something that is surprising because you were not expecting it
